result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew David Smith

records.addlTxt: State's Witness List - JT12 - 01-18-23

11:24 AM Defendant Matthew David Smith in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Matthew David Smith.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Gramstrup: plead to Ct 2: carry concealed, DRI remainder, joint rec of fine inclusive of costs of $500.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.   Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Off the record 11:27 AM.  Back on the record 11:32 AM.  Atty Gramstrup updates- deferring to defendant as to whether or not this will proceed to plea.  Def does not want to enter a plea.  Court will set 1 day jury trial.  Court addresses defendant.  State asks to amend the criminal complaint until final pre-trial, notes additional bail jumps may be charged; Court grants leave to file amended complaint.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on December 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on January 18, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:23 AM Defendant Matthew David Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Matthew David Smith.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin.  Case on for final pre-trial (was set for plea), but def unable to appear in person.  Resetting plea so def can appear in person and prepay costs.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 28, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Discussion of def's Rusk County underlying case.  Court explains drop-dead date is 10/13/22.  Bond continues.

Defense attorney updates the Court: offer received, requesting additional STC.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 11:04 AM Called 22CF99 for STC. Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew David Smith not in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Matthew David Smith. Def was here June 27 for ARGN, had notice and still FTA by any means.  State requests to forfeit any cash and WA nation wide.  Attny stands mute.  Court issues WA $500 cash, only judge may quash.

2:40 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew David Smith appeared by video.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup appeared by video for Matthew David Smith. Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on August 11, 2022 at 10:45 am.

2:49 PM Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew David Smith in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Matthew David Smith. Case is on for preliminary hearing.  State calls first witness, Trooper Anthony Olson, who is sworn in and testifies.  State asks Court to take judicial notice of Rusk County case 21CF250 and the bond therein; court does.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Gramstrup crosses.  State rests and asks for bind over.  Atty Gramstrup stands mute on bind over.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information.  Bond continues.
Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Arraignment on June 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 2, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

01:29 PM Defendant, Matthew David Smith, appeared in person with Attorney Christopher Gramstrup by video.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State.  If def qualifies for PD, atty Christopher Gramstrup willing to take this case as a PD appointment.  Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, requests formal reading.  Court does formal reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Prior to leaving the courthouse, the defendant shall report to the sheriff's dept. to provide fingerprints.  WTLPH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Initial appearance on May 11, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
